context_of_use: This use case allows admins and power users to manage user accounts, perform bulk operations, and maintain products and inventory including pricing.
description: Enables admins and power users to manage user accounts, perform bulk operations, and maintain products and inventory including pricing.
triggering_event: Admin or power user initiates management tasks.
preconditions: Admin or power user is logged into the system.
User accounts and products exist in the system.
postconditions: User accounts are updated as per admin actions.
Products are created, updated, or managed as per admin actions.
assumptions: Admins have the necessary permissions to manage user accounts.
Power users have the necessary permissions to handle bulk operations.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall allow power users to handle bulk operations.
The system shall allow admins to create new products.
The system shall allow admins to update product prices.
The system shall allow admins to manage inventory levels.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the specific permissions for power users.
main_flow: 1. Admin logs into the system → System verifies credentials and grants access.
2. Admin selects 'Manage User Accounts' → System displays user management interface.
3. Admin performs user management actions → System updates user accounts accordingly.
4. Power user logs into the system → System verifies credentials and grants access.
5. Power user selects 'Handle Bulk Operations' → System displays bulk operations interface.
6. Power user performs bulk operations → System processes and updates records.
7. Admin selects 'Create Products' → System displays product creation interface.
8. Admin enters product details and submits → System creates new product.
9. Admin selects 'Update Product Prices' → System displays pricing update interface.
10. Admin updates product prices and submits → System updates pricing information.
11. Admin selects 'Manage Inventory' → System displays inventory management interface.
12. Admin manages inventory levels → System updates inventory records.
